metadata.title: USN-5597-1 -- Linux kernel (Oracle) vulnerability
metadata.description: It was discovered that the virtual terminal driver in the Linux kernel did not properly handle VGA console font changes, leading to an out-of-bounds write. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-5597-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  linux-tools-4.15.0-1105-oracle - 4.15.0-1105.116~16.04.1 linux-oracle-tools-4.15.0-1105 - 4.15.0-1105.116~16.04.1 linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1105-oracle - 4.15.0-1105.116~16.04.1 linux-modules-extra-4.15.0-1105-oracle - 4.15.0-1105.116~16.04.1 linux-modules-4.15.0-1105-oracle - 4.15.0-1105.116~16.04.1 linux-image-4.15.0-1105-oracle - 4.15.0-1105.116~16.04.1 linux-buildinfo-4.15.0-1105-oracle - 4.15.0-1105.116~16.04.1 linux-headers-4.15.0-1105-oracle - 4.15.0-1105.116~16.04.1 linux-oracle-headers-4.15.0-1105 - 4.15.0-1105.116~16.04.1 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro  linux-signed-oracle - 4.15.0.1105.89 linux-signed-image-oracle - 4.15.0.1105.89 linux-tools-oracle - 4.15.0.1105.89 linux-headers-oracle - 4.15.0.1105.89 linux-oracle - 4.15.0.1105.89 linux-image-oracle - 4.15.0.1105.89 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
